Today, Rafizi claimed St Regis Langkawi had been making continuous losses since its ground breaking ceremony in 2013."I too can make a hotel business like this, I think it will be more profitable. I can make more profit than the continuous losses (by St Regis Langkawi),"Rafizi said it made zero revenues for 2015 and made a net loss of RM2.7 million in 2015, and a net loss of RM3.7 million in 2014.Rafizi said it raises the question on whether they can generate enough income to pay off their loans and debts," he added.Firstly you bodoh. Ground-breaking means START OF CONSTRUCTION - not start of business. It is normal for investments to make losses during the construction phase since it generates ZERO revenues but still have costs.The hotel only opened in April 2016 and has had a great reception and good occupancy rates.In 2004, Airlines had been complaining that there was not enough hotel rooms in Langkawi and had hoped for hotel rooms to be doubled - saying that demand drastically outstrips supply.Hotels in Langkawi recorded occupancy rates of 75% to 95% in 1Q2016. “Langkawi, one of the hotel markets with the highest average daily rate (ADR) in the country, is expected to continue performing well with the recent opening of the St Regis hotel, It has completely changed the high-end luxury travel for Langkawi” says The Edge.A report by UPM also said that Langkawi stands to lose out on a major potential source of revenue  if there was no focus on the high-net-worth individuals marketThis is why the Lembaga Pembangunan Langkawi (LADA) dan Aset Tanah Nasional Bhd decided to partner with Peter Sondakh, who owns the St Regis Hotels in Bali and Jakarta to quickly develop this hotel in Langkawi.One of only 30 Starwoods group resort hotels in the world, St Regis had already won multiple coveted international property awards 2016-2017.It  was honoured with two awards, the ‘Best Hotel Interior Asia Pacific’ and ‘Best International Hotel Interior’ and is also the proud recipient of the Condé Nast 2017 Award for Excellence – Best for Families.On Tripadvisor, the hotel also has an excellent 4.5 stars out of 5 rating out of 211 reviews.Yes, the hotel has been wildly successful after opening in drawing high-end tourists - not to mention the money that these high-end tourists spend while traveling to Malaysia.Tourism has boomed last year 2016 and will continue to boom this year as the govt continues to do more to promote and develop our tourism industry - which is the second largest industry after manufacturing.And yet, we have absolute idiots like Rafizi who continues to attack every single project while sabotaging our economy just to incite hate everyday.Everyone must remember that Rafizi has already admitted that his job is to menghasut rakyat tiap-tiap hari.And this is what he is doing again today even though it makes him look like a complete fool.
